programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc: A whole world in a bamboo cane Jean-Baptiste Dubois explores all that bamboo canes have to offer for creating garden areas and objects. Gardens and arboretums are often the guarantors of rare or precious heritage plants. How should they be protected? Visiting the Grand Courtoiseau gardens. Don't panic: Tanguy's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Ice palace and snow mountain In four days, the team hopes to climb Min Teke, the highest mountain in the region at 5,500 metres. From towering ice walls, to unexpected rock falls plus the sheer quantity of equipment to carry, the task for the young women and their guide is far from easy. Directed by: Martin Schilt (Switzerland, 2020)

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Marinated chilli peppers and stuffed sweet peppers Mathieu Cloutier marinates biquinho chilli peppers and prepares stuffed and bread-crumbed fried sweet peppers. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Geneviève and Éric, Estrie (Lawrenceville) Determined to leave everything to run a farm, Éric had his work cut out to persuade Geneviève to follow him with their three children. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.sub-title: Citadelle de Blaye/Marc Hertrich et Nicolas Adnet/ Sandrine Pagny
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Blaye Citadel on the Gironde estuary. Welcome to the world of the interior designers Marc Hertrich and Nicolas Adnet, of the MHNA Studio. The go-to addresses in Paris for everything Chinese. Bewitching colours and shapes: with Sandrine Pagny ceramics become works of fantasy. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: GARDEN PARTY (SAISON 2)
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Aude, from Carcassonne to the Cathar Country Above all known for its mediaeval towns and its Cathar history, the French department of the Aude also offers some impressive scenery: the Corbières Massif and the Galamus Gorges. Superbly preserved, on the banks of the Canal du Midi and the River Aude, Carcassonne is a town forgotten by time. Directed by: Philippe Vergeot (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Échappées belles
programme.desc: From village to village in Morbihan Morbihan is an exceptional summer destination for French and foreign tourists alike. With its wild coastline, Gulf and islands, the region has a lot to offer. So, when the warmer weather arrives, visitors quickly flock to its coastal villages. By contrast, the lesser-known villages further inland tend to be overlooked. Presenter: Ismaël Khelifa.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.sub-title: La haute couture face à la pandémie
programme.desc:
Season 6, Episode 35:

Haute couture in a pandemic How to face up to the Covid-19 pandemic in the world of haute couture? Alexis Mabille and the artists and craftsmen working in the world of fashion offer their answers. Focus on the photographers and runway show organisers who invented sustainable alternatives to bring back the lost magic.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Thai cuisine We explore Thai cuisine with Bruno Blanchet. From green papaya salad to coconut milk soup, the chefs Yao Truadmakkha and Ramida Inthanoochit help us discover the flavours of their cuisine. Presenter: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: La vigne est belle
programme.desc:
The alchemists
November. The winegrowers prepare the vineyards and warehouses for the winter. It's time to blend the year's wines and for the Mexican and Guatemalan seasonal workers to return home. The year ends with tastings, good 'piquettes' recipes, retirement for some and concerns about climate change.
Director: Pascal Brouard (Canada, 2022)

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: Éric takes us to explore the marshes of the Charente-Maritime, an ideal ecosystem for horse breeding. Nathalie tries making Gigondas, in Orange. In Laval, Julie meets Mounir, a super presenter doing everything possible to connect people. In Paris, Yvan presents one of the most surprising "women from the 6th floor". Presented by: Éric Perrin, Nathalie Simon, Julie Hattu, Yvan Hallouin.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: The Sancerrois The Sancerrois: an unspoilt micro-region on the banks of the Loire. Éric Louis welcomes us to his vineyards to share in his love of Sancerre wine, the Godon family let us in on the secrets of Crottin de Chavignol cheese, and we explore the Gargaude islands with Florence Delaroche. Presenter: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Ça roule en cuisine
programme.sub-title: Le restaurant bio Claire et Hugo
programme.desc: Claire and Hugo's organic restaurant Sophie Menut drives towards Sainte-Savine, just outside Troyes, and Claire and Hugo's organic restaurant. Chef Claire Baubrit and baker Hugo Lallemand are both self-taught and passionate about their profession. They also had a food truck, before taking on the challenge of opening a real restaurant with its own bakery-grocery store. Presented by: Sophie Menut.

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Les Troyens Inspired by Virgil's "Aeneid", "Les Troyens" is a five act opera by Hector Berlioz, composed between 1856 and 1858. Priam, Cassandre, Didon, Énée, Andromaque and Hécube... at the service of a major lyrical tragedy, in a new version produced by Dmitri Tcherniakov in 2019. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Aude, from Carcassonne to the Cathar Country Above all known for its mediaeval towns and its Cathar history, the French department of the Aude also offers some impressive scenery: the Corbières Massif and the Galamus Gorges. Superbly preserved, on the banks of the Canal du Midi and the River Aude, Carcassonne is a town forgotten by time. Directed by: Philippe Vergeot (season 3, France, 2016)

By contrast, the lesser-known villages further inland tend to be overlooked. Presenter: Ismaël Khelifa.

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Rigoletto Three acts and four scenes for "Rigoletto", by Giuseppe Verdi, based on a play by Victor Hugo "Le Roi S'Amuse", created at the Teatro La Fenice in 1851. With extracts from Claus Guth's 2016 production at the Opéra de Paris. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)
